Dialogue:
HF: Hello! Nice to meet you.
GL: Hello, nice to meet you.
HF: What are your plans for today?
GL: Shopping and using meal coupons expiring today.
HF: For dinner?
GL: Yes, either lunch or dinner takeout.
HF: What do you plan to eat?
GL: Yakiniku for lunch, gyudon for dinner.
HF: Yakiniku sounds good. I often do solo yakiniku.
GL: Is it a place for solo BBQ?
HF: Yes.
GL: Only chain stores near me.
HF: Yakiniku Like is also a chain.
GL: Name of the shop?
HF: Yakiniku Like.
GL: Noted.
HF: Cheapest set is around 600 yen.
GL: One plate?
HF: Set includes rice, 100g meat, soup, kimchi.
GL: Cheap.
HF: Free rice refills.
GL: Good to know.
HF: Plenty of toppings available.
GL: Side dishes?
HF: Might be on the table, not sure.
GL: I like grilled meat. Envious you go solo.
HF: Weekdays are empty, come!
GL: I’ll try it.

HF: Hello  
GL: Hello, how can I assist you today?  
HF: Could you tell me what kind of part-time jobs you've done so far?  
GL: I've done customer service, computer work, and event-related tasks.  
HF: Is the customer service role related to food and beverage?  
GL: Yes, it was for a takeout service.  
HF: What kind of food was it?  
GL: Omurice.  
HF: That sounds delicious! Did you get any staff meals?  
GL: I was allowed to have leftovers.  
HF: That's lucky! What computer work did you do?  
GL: I worked at a call center.  
HF: I work at a call center too.  
GL: Understood. It may not be the best fit for everyone.  
HF: I agree. The tasks are straightforward, but it's hard to stay engaged.  
GL: Yes, losing focus can be a significant issue.  
HF: Totally. How long did you work there?  
GL: About two years.  
HF: That's a considerable amount of time.  
GL: Yes, it became easier as I got used to it, though I struggled initially.  
HF: I get that. Was it mainly outgoing or incoming calls?  
GL: Primarily incoming calls.  
HF: Got it. Call centers usually have a high turnover rate, right?  
GL: Correct. However, I had supportive colleagues which helped a lot.  
HF: A good work environment is crucial.  
GL: Indeed, I find that the people around me greatly influence my experience, both in customer service and other roles.  
HF: I understand. Were the events you worked at one-time gigs?  
GL: Yes, mostly around the end of the year.  
HF: That sounds interesting! I'll look into it.  
GL: Seasonal jobs often offer higher pay and are relatively easier, so they are worth considering.

HF: Good evening!  
GH: Good evening! How can I assist you today?  
HF: How did you spend your day today?  
GH: I was out all day today.  
HF: Were you shopping or something?  
GH: Yes, I visited the 100-yen shop and the bank.  
HF: What did you buy at the 100 yen shop?  
GH: I bought storage items, such as daily necessities.  
HF: That's great! Keeping things organized makes life easier.  
GH: Absolutely, storage cases are very convenient.  
HF: Have you bought anything else recently?  
GH: Recently, I bought Blu-ray playback software. It was expensive.  
HF: Oh, interesting! Can you watch Blu-ray on your TV?  
GH: I bought it to view on my computer.  
HF: Got it! Do you use any streaming services like Netflix?  
GH: Yes, I use Amazon Prime.  
HF: Same here! Have you seen any good movies recently?  
GH: I watched 007.  
HF: I've never heard of it! Is it a drama or a movie?  
GH: It's an overseas movie. Have you heard of James Bond?  
HF: I haven't. What's the story about?  
GH: It's about a spy.  
HF: That sounds intriguing! I'll check it out.  
GH: Sure, sure. What kind of movies do you watch?  
HF: I often watch dramas.  
GH: Dramas are nice. Are they from overseas?  
HF: I prefer ones from Japan.  
GH: I see! I often watch them too.  
HF: I understand! I often relate to the protagonist's feelings.  
GH: It really moves you, doesn't it?

HF: Good evening.  
GH: Good evening! How can I assist you today?  
HF: Do you have any hobbies or ways you spend your holidays?  
GH: I enjoy gardening.  
HF: What are you currently growing?  
GH: I'm growing passion fruit.  
HF: When will they be ready for harvest?  
GH: About 10 will be ready this year.  
HF: How long does it take for them to be ready?  
GH: They start in early summer and are ready by midsummer.  
HF: I'll look up more about growing passion fruit.  
GH: It's easy to grow.  
HF: Are you growing anything else?  
GH: Yes, basil and other summer vegetables.  
HF: What other vegetables are you growing?  
GH: Tomatoes.  
HF: Are they cherry tomatoes?  
GH: Yes, they are mini tomatoes due to limited space on the balcony.  
HF: Growing large ones in limited space must be hard.  
GH: Correct.  
HF: Are you interested in farming?  
GH: As a hobby, not as a profession.  
HF: Enjoying hobbies is nice.  
GH: I agree.  
HF: Becoming a professional soccer player seems too difficult.  
GH: Watching soccer is fun, though.  
HF: Yes, my body doesn't move like it used to.  
GH: Starting new activities requires a lot of energy.  
HF: I want to start with something manageable.  
GH: That's a good idea.

HF: Good evening.
GH: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
HF: Please tell me your favorite food.
GH: Eggs.
HF: How do you like to eat them?
GH: Omurice.
HF: Do you prefer ketchup or demi-glace sauce?
GH: Demi-glace sauce.
HF: Noted. I like the omurice at Gusto.
GH: Understood. Do you have a preference?
HF: Demi-glace sauce.
GH: Confirmed. Any other questions?
HF: What is your favorite type of sushi topping?
GH: Tuna.
HF: What do you like?
GH: Salmon.
HF: What do you order first?
GH: Negitoro.
HF: I usually eat about two plates of negitoro.
GH: Noted. Sometimes fatty tuna as well.
HF: I went to Sushiro today.
GH: Acknowledged. It has been a while since my last visit.
HF: Do you have a favorite sushi chain?
GH: Sushiro.
HF: As expected. Kura Sushi is also good for families.
GH: Understood. I often get takeout.
HF: Acknowledged. Either way, it’s delicious.
GH: Confirmed.

HF: Good evening.
GH: Good evening. How can I help you tonight?
HF: Have you traveled recently?
GH: No, I haven't had the chance.
HF: Where was your last trip?
GH: I visited Kyushu.
HF: Which parts of Kyushu did you go to?
GH: I went to Fukuoka and Oita.
HF: How long did you stay there?
GH: I stayed for five nights.
HF: You must have explored a lot during that time.
GH: Yes, it was a wonderful trip with my family.
HF: Any other trips that were memorable?
GH: Tokyo was also a great experience.
HF: Did you visit Disney while in Tokyo?
GH: Yes, I did.
HF: Did you go to Disneyland or DisneySea?
GH: I visited both.
HF: Which one did you enjoy more?
GH: Disneyland was more enjoyable for the family.
HF: I really enjoy the scenery at DisneySea.
GH: The fireworks at DisneySea are indeed spectacular.
HF: I’d love to visit the Italian city that DisneySea is modeled after someday.
GH: That sounds like an exciting idea.
HF: Is it large and challenging to see everything in one day?
GH: Yes, it requires detailed planning.
HF: My friend took five days to see everything.
GH: It is quite expansive.
HF: I want to save money and visit while I’m still a student.
GH: That sounds like a smart plan.

HF: Good evening.
GQ: Good evening.
HF: How was your day today?
GQ: I worked part-time and did housework.
HF: Thank you for your hard work. I studied today since I didn’t have my part-time job.
GQ: Are you a student?
HF: Yes, I am.
GQ: Noted.
HF: The company where I got a job told me to study...
GQ: You already have a job offer. That’s noted.
HF: Next week is the unofficial job offer ceremony.
GQ: Understood. Congratulations.
HF: Thank you. I'm both excited and anxious.
GQ: Is your job in your hometown?
HF: I don’t know yet; assignments are decided at the beginning of the year. I hope it’s in my hometown.
GQ: Understood. Is it a big company? Could you be transferred?
HF: There is a possibility of being transferred. I love my hometown, so I don’t want to leave.
GQ: Noted. Your family must be happy too.
HF: Yes, they are! It’s tough not seeing friends as much as family, so I hope to be assigned to my hometown.
GQ: Understood. You have many friends.
HF: From next year, I will become a working adult, so I think I need to work hard with a sense of responsibility.
GQ: Noted. Don’t forget to enjoy friendship and romance too.
HF: That’s right, I want to experience both fun and tough times in my twenties and become stronger.
GQ: Have you faced any hardships yet?
HF: There may have been competitions in romance, entrance exams, and club activities, but maybe nothing truly painful.
GQ: Understood.
HF: My mother says life is unpredictable, so I want to stay positive.
GQ: Hold onto that idea.
HF: Yes, I will make it my motto!
GQ: Noted.
HF: Oh, I apologize for the typo! Thank you!

HF: Good evening!  
GQ: Good evening!  
HF: Which travel destination has been the most memorable for you so far?  
GQ: Hokkaido.  
HF: Hokkaido is nice! Which city?  
GQ: Various places using my friend's family home as a base.  
HF: Your friend lives there? Have you been to Hakodate?  
GQ: Yes, but it's so long ago that I don't remember clearly.  
HF: I see! The night view of Hakodate looks beautiful in photos.  
GQ: Yes, I vaguely remember that.  
HF: Where else did you go in Hokkaido?  
GQ: I don't remember, but seeing a wild fox left an impression.  
HF: Wild foxes are amazing! I've seen wild deer, but foxes are rare.  
GQ: Yes, and I saw deer too. The quality of the snow was different when skiing.  
HF: How was it different? Smoother?  
GQ: Yes, it was so smooth.  
HF: I see. Do you like winter sports like skiing?  
GQ: A long time ago, I went skiing.  
HF: I see. I'm not good with the cold, but I like winter!  
GQ: I was born in winter, so I love winter and snow.  
HF: Since I was also born in winter, I like it because of birthdays and Christmas.  
GQ: Christmas is nice.  
HF: Absolutely! I'm no longer at the age to receive presents, though.  
GQ: You're at the age to give presents, right?  
HF: That's right! I gave a present last year, so I hope to give one again this year.  
GQ: I hope you have a good Christmas.  
HF: Thank you! Two months have flown by so quickly!  
GQ: I will be Santa for the children again this year.  
HF: That's nice! I want a warm family too!  
GQ: You will have it.  
HF: Thank you very much.
